skill.name: fiftyone-pr-triage
skill.description: Triage FiftyOne GitHub issues by validating status, categorizing resolution, and generating standardized responses. Use when reviewing issues to determine if fixed, won't fix, not reproducible, no longer relevant, or still valid.
skill.summary: Triage FiftyOne GitHub issues by validating status, categorizing resolution, and generating standard...
skill.author: AdonaiVera

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and response templates for GitHub issue triage. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reads are present. The skill guides AI agents on how to categorize FiftyOne issues but does not perform any actions itself.

content.value_statement: Managing GitHub issues requires consistent categorization and clear responses. This skill provides standardized triage workflows and response templates for FiftyOne maintainers to close issues efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Categorize issues into five triage states
Search codebase using grep and find commands
Check git history for recent fixes
Search closed issues and merged PRs
Follow a decision tree for consistent triage
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI and git access to function fully
Only works with FiftyOne repository issues
Does not automatically close issues without human review
Cannot reproduce bugs without proper environment setup

use_cases.title: Maintain repository health
use_cases.description: Keep the FiftyOne issue tracker organized by closing outdated or resolved issues with clear explanations.

use_cases.title: Contribute triaging help
use_cases.description: Assist maintainers by categorizing new issues and identifying duplicates using the standard workflow.

use_cases.title: Streamline issue workflow
use_cases.description: Apply consistent triage rules across the project to reduce time spent on issue management.

prompt_templates.title: Quick triage
prompt_templates.prompt: Triage this FiftyOne GitHub issue. First read the full issue details, then search the codebase and git history to determine if it is already fixed, won't fix, not reproducible, no longer relevant, or still valid. Use the fiftyone-pr-triage skill.

prompt_templates.title: Bug reproduction check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the fiftyone-pr-triage skill to check if this bug report can be reproduced. Search the codebase for related code and check recent commits for fixes. Categorize the issue and generate an appropriate response.

prompt_templates.title: Duplicate detection
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for related closed issues and merged PRs using gh commands from the fiftyone-pr-triage skill. Identify if this is a duplicate and generate a response pointing to the original issue.

prompt_templates.title: Feature request triage
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the fiftyone-pr-triage decision tree to this feature request. Check if it is by design, out of scope, or still valid. Generate a response explaining the decision with appropriate reasoning.

output_examples.input: Triage this issue: User reports that fiftyone.load_dataset fails with large datasets on FiftyOne v0.21
output: â€¢ Initial assessment: Requires investigation of load_dataset implementation
â€¢ Response: Confirms issue, requests more details, adds to bug backlog

best_practices: Always verify the FiftyOne version before categorizing as no longer relevant
Search git history and closed issues before marking as new bug
Provide specific reasoning when closing issues as won't fix
Request minimal reproducible examples when issue is not reproducible
anti_patterns: Closing issues without searching for duplicates first
Marking issues as fixed without verifying the fix commit
Using vague responses that do not explain the categorization decision
Skipping the reproduction step for bug reports

faq.question: What versions of FiftyOne does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill works with all FiftyOne versions. When triage reveals version mismatch, it flags the issue as no longer relevant.

faq.question: Does this skill close issues automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates response templates but requires a human maintainer to review and post the response before closing.

faq.question: What commands does the skill use for searching?
faq.answer: It uses grep, find, git log, and GitHub CLI commands like gh issue list and gh pr list for comprehensive search.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads issue data and generates text responses. It does not modify any files or access credentials.

faq.question: Why was my issue closed as not reproducible?
faq.answer: The triager could not reproduce the issue with the provided information. The response will request minimal reproducible examples.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated bots?
faq.answer: This skill provides human-readable guidance for consistent triage. Unlike automated bots, it adapts responses based on investigation findings.
